required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Incentives for YMCA Based Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Empirical Testing of a Widely Available Insurance-based Monetary Incentive Program for Exercise: A Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will conduct a randomized controlled trial to test financial incentive programs (versus control) to promote physical activity among 330 adults who have a YMCA membership. Participants will have the opportunity to earn up to $100 or $200 (depending on the condition they are assigned to) for attending at least 50 sessions at the YMCA over 6 months. Participants will have two 6-month windows during which they will have the opportunity to earn the incentive. In addition to the incentives, participants will complete research assessments every 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Number of YMCA visits
primary_outcome.description: Number of sessions (max 1 per day) a person signs into the YMCA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes of physical activity weighted by intensity, expressed in metabolic equivalent (MET) minutes per week as determined by accelerometers (Actigraph [model wGT3x-BT]) worn during one-week periods.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported minutes of leisure time physical activity (inside and outside the YMCA) per week weighted by intensity

other_outcome.measure: Change in Self-Reported Habit of Physical Activity Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's habits regarding exercise, with a minimum value of 1 and a maximum value of 7, higher scores indicate a stronger habit.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's anticipated feelings of remorse if they do not do exercise, or achieve the incentives, on a scale from 1-11, with higher scores indicating more anticipated regret.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's opportunity to do regular aerobic physical activity, with scores ranging from 1-7, and higher scores indicating more opportunity for physical activity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's physical and psychological capability to do regular aerobic physical activity with scores ranging from 1-7, and higher scores indicating more capability for physical activity.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Exercise Facility Use Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures access and membership to fitness facilities.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Physical Activity Hedonic/Reflective Motivation
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the extent to which a person's motivation for physical activity is rooted in reflective and/or hedonic processes. There are two subscales. The hedonic subscale ranges from 0-10, with higher scores indicating more hedonic motivation for physical activity. The reflective subscale ranges from 0-10 with higher scores indicating more reflective motivation for physical activity.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's perception of their subjective social status

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the extent to which a person is responsive to external rewards

other_outcome.measure: Change in Consideration of Future Consequences
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the extent to which a person considers the future (delayed) consequences of their actions

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the extent to which a person discounts future rewards and prioritizes immediate rewards

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the extent to which a person chooses actions in an attempt to avoid experiencing losses

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures a person's perception of their overall health and quality of life, scores range from 1-5 with higher scores indicating poorer health outcomes.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life and Health Status (EQ-5D-5L)
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L comprises a short descriptive system questionnaire and a visual analogue scale (EQ VAS) that are cognitively undemanding, taking only a few minutes to complete. The questionnaire provides a simple descriptive profile of a respondent's health state. The EQ VAS provides an alternative way to elicit an individual's rating of their own overall current health. When the descriptive system profile is linked to a 'value set', a single summary index value for health status is derived that can be used in economic evaluations of health-care interventions. A value set provides values (weights) for each health state description according to the preferences of the general population of a country/region. Value sets for the EQ-5D-5L and 3L versions are available in a large and growing number of countries.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, and months 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Measures the amount of time a person worked and was expected to work in the past 7-28 days; and their perceived job performance when at work

arm_group.description: Participants are offered an incentive of $100 to complete 50 exercise sessions at the YMCA within 6 months (Description of incentive 1)
Participants are offered an incentive of $100 to complete 50 exercise sessions at the YMCA within 6 months (Description of incentive 2).
Participants are offered an incentive of $200 to complete 50 exercise sessions at the YMCA within 6 months (Description of incentive 1).
Participants are offered an incentive of $200 to complete 50 exercise sessions at the YMCA within 6 months (Description of incentive 2).
Participants complete all assessments, and are eligible to receive compensation for participating in the research components of the study.

intervention.description: Monetary incentives, provided in the form of pre-loaded Visa debit cards are provided to encourage exercise.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. A current member, or willing to become a current member of one of the following branches of the YMCA:
1. Bayside Family YMCA (Barrington, RI)
2. Cranston YMCA (Cranston, RI)
3. East Side/Mt. Hope YMCA (Providence, RI)
4. Kent County YMCA (Warwick, RI)
5. Newman YMCA (Seekonk, MA)
6. South County YMCA (South Kingston, RI)
2. Age 18 years or older
3. Physically capable of engaging in exercise
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Not a current member, and unwilling to become a member of one of the above listed YMCA branches.
2. Under age 18.
3. Physically incapable of exercise
4. Doctor has recommended that you should not exercise because of a current health condition

overall_official.affiliation: Brown University School of Public Health
Brown University School of Public Health

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data will be shared with interested parties after all of the initial study analyses and outcomes have been published.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available 1 year after study completion.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: All data access requests will be reviewed by a panel prior to acceptance
